ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: When circumstances prevent me from achieving an important goal, I find it hard to keep trying
Notes: 1=Very false for me; 2=Somewhat false for me; 3=Somewhat true for me; 4=Very true for me

ElementDescription: When an event I am looking forward to is cancelled, I lose the energy to arrange an alternative
Notes: 1=Very false for me; 2=Somewhat false for me; 3=Somewhat true for me; 4=Very true for me

ElementDescription: When I don't get what I want, I lose interest in my day-to-day tasks
Notes: 1=Very false for me; 2=Somewhat false for me; 3=Somewhat true for me; 4=Very true for me

ElementDescription: If I have been working hard at something I lose motivation if I don't get the reward I deserve
Notes: 1=Very false for me; 2=Somewhat false for me; 3=Somewhat true for me; 4=Very true for me

ElementDescription: When something good I am expecting doesn't happen, I feel less enthusiastic about life for a while
Notes: 1=Very false for me; 2=Somewhat false for me; 3=Somewhat true for me; 4=Very true for me

ElementDescription: Sum of items 1-5 for Frustrative Nonreward Responsiveness Subscale (FNR)
